intro: Chaerophyllum cadonense, commonly known as the Cadonese peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its fern-like leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is often found in coastal areas and is known for its aromatic foliage. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
